Package com.github.yellowstonegames.old.v300

Interface LegacyRandom

All Superinterfaces:
com.github.tommyettinger.ds.support.EnhancedRandom
All Known Implementing Classes:
DiverRNG, GWTRNG, LightRNG, LinnormRNG, LongPeriodRNG, SilkRNG, ThrustAltRNG, XoshiroStarPhi32RNG
public interface LegacyRandom extends com.github.tommyettinger.ds.support.EnhancedRandom
An alternate version of EnhancedRandom that intentionally implements certain methods incorrectly, for compatibility with SquidLib 3.0.0. Currently, nextSignedInt(int) and nextSignedLong(long) are incorrectly implemented for compatibility, and that makes EnhancedRandom.nextSignedInt(int, int) incorrect too. Other methods here are implemented as EnhancedRandom does in its default implementations.

    This is slightly different from how EnhancedRandom implements this method, and this version may have some bias for large bounds (more bias than EnhancedRandom has).
    default int
    nextSignedInt​(int outerBound)
    This is subtly incorrect; if outerBound is 0, then this returns 0 only very rarely, even if outerBound is small, like -1 or -2.
    default long
    nextSignedLong​(long outerBound)
    This is buggier than a bumblebee; do not use this in production.

      default int nextInt​(int bound)
      This is slightly different from how EnhancedRandom implements this method, and this version may have some bias for large bounds (more bias than EnhancedRandom has).
      Specified by:
      nextInt in interface com.github.tommyettinger.ds.support.EnhancedRandom
      Parameters:
      bound - the outer exclusive bound; if non-positive, this returns 0
      Returns:
      a random int between 0 (inclusive) and bound (exclusive); never negative

    • nextSignedInt

      default int nextSignedInt​(int outerBound)
      This is subtly incorrect; if outerBound is 0, then this returns 0 only very rarely, even if outerBound is small, like -1 or -2. It is implemented as SquidLib 3.0.0 implemented it to reproduce behavior.
      Specified by:
      nextSignedInt in interface com.github.tommyettinger.ds.support.EnhancedRandom
      Parameters:
      outerBound - outer bound, may be positive or negative
      Returns:
      an int between 0 (inclusive, but very rarely) and outerBound (exclusive)

    • nextSignedLong

      default long nextSignedLong​(long outerBound)
      This is buggier than a bumblebee; do not use this in production. It is only here to reproduce bugs from 3.0.0.
      Specified by:
      nextSignedLong in interface com.github.tommyettinger.ds.support.EnhancedRandom
      Parameters:
      outerBound - the outer bound, positive or negative; will probably not be respected
      Returns:
      honestly, this could return anything -- a whale and a potted plant are possibilities

    • nextDouble

      default double nextDouble()
      Gets a random double between 0 and 1 (inclusive on 0, exclusive on 1). This one isn't incorrectly implemented, it's just different from how EnhancedRandom does it.
